item.title: GTA Online: 8 Best Aircrafts, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Best aircraft like Buzzard, Avenger, and Raiju make gameplay easier in GTA Online - new players should consider investing.
  • The Sparrow allows easy grinding for heists, while the B-11 Strikeforce excels in dogfights, well-suited for experienced players.
  • High-speed Mammoth Hydra and versatile Akula are essential for various combat scenarios, offering good weapons and stealth capabilities.

The Grand Theft Auto franchise is predominantly known for its missions and driving experience, with every installment featuring a wide range of vehicles to choose from. Aircraft have been in the series for more than 2 decades. However, they were often sidelined in previous entries. In GTA Online , it's a different story.

Owning a good aircraft is now a necessity as it makes the gameplay experience much easier. They are faster to travel in and some of them have great offensive capabilities making them great enough to survive in public lobbies. So, here are some of the best aircraft players can own in GTA Online.

8 Nagasaki Buzzard Attack Chopper

Price: $1,750,000

Based on

MD Helicopters AH-6 Little Bird

Where to buy

Warstock Cache & Carry

Top speed

145.00 mph

The Buzzard Attack Chopper is a great starter aircraft that every new player should go for. It is quite cheap for what players are getting and is one of the fastest helicopters in the game with offensive capabilities. It has machine guns that deal below-average damage, but homing and non-homing missiles do the job.

Players can spawn three Buzzard Attack Choppers at a time - one through Pegasus, one from the CEO vehicle menu, and one can be called as a personal vehicle.

7 Sparrow

Price: $1,815,000

Based on

Bell Model 47 "Sioux"

Where to buy

Warstock Cache & Carry (Kosatka upgrade menu)

Top speed

168.75 mph

When it comes to aircraft that provide the most convenience, the Sparrow comes to mind. It is a 2-seater offensive chopper that players can only customize inside their Kosatka submarine. It makes it very easy to grind the Cayo Perico heist, the best way to earn money, much easier. In addition, unlike personal aircraft, it spawns near the player's location. It is among the top 5 fastest helicopters in the game.

However, one of the downsides is that, like Oppressor MkII, players can either equip machine guns or missiles. It also has countermeasures available, making it much easier to avoid forthcoming homing missiles. There's also a Sea Sparrow helicopter in GTA Online which has pontoons at the bottom allowing it to land on the water. However, it can't be stored in Kosatka and costs the same, so players prefer the regular sparrow.

6 B-11 Strikeforce

Price: $3,800,000

Based on

Fairchild Republic A-10 Thunderbolt II "Warthog"

Where to buy

Warstock Cache & Carry

Top speed

163.75 mph

In the world of Raiju, Hydra, and Lazer, the B-11 Strikeforce remains a somewhat underrated aircraft in GTA Online. Only the hardcore aircraft enthusiast appreciates this plane. It is among the very few jets with a missile barrage along with a bomb bay. One of the unique features of this aircraft is that it slows down a little as players get closer to the surface, making it easier to hit a target and land the plane.

Strikeforce is quick and has a good turning circle, making it very good for dogfighting. Players should definitely give Strikeforce a try and let their primary jet some rest.

5 Mammoth Hydra

Price: $3,000,000 - $3,990,000 (Trade price)

Based on

British Aerospace Harrier II

Where to buy

Warstock Cache & Carry

Top speed

209.25 mph

Hydra is a fan-favorite aircraft in GTA Online . However, its popularity has diminished with time. It was the very first jet with the vertical take-off and landing (VTOL) mode. Previously, Hydra had explosive cannons that could tear apart anything in seconds; Rockstar Games nerfed them, but are still viable. Along with this explosive cannon, Hydra comes with homing and non-homing missiles.

It is a Pegasus vehicle that players can take to their Hanger store and customize, though only the color can be changed. One issue with Hydra is that, despite having a high top speed, it has quite a slow launch. All the early-generation aircraft with VTOL have this issue, but once Hydra catches up with speed, it goes pretty fast. The best thing about Hydra is its price. It costs almost half of the P-996 Lazer and provides the ultimate value for money.

4 Avenger

Price: $3,450,000

Based on

V-22 Osprey

Where to buy

Warstock Cache & Carry

Top speed

178.50 mph

Over time, Rockstar Games poured some love into the Avenger and made it one of the most powerful aircraft in GTA Online. It is a flying fortress through which players can easily wreak havoc in the lobby with their friends. Players can equip it with a remote gun turret which can one-shoot non-armored vehicles.

After the San Andreas Mercenaries DLC, players can take their Avenger to Hanger to add homing missiles, machine guns, and bombs along with other performance upgrades. It can take up to 23 homing missiles or 8 RPGs before going down. Players can also upgrade their Avenger with a stealth module to further enhance its defenses. However, its stealth mode is very boring as it causes players to just stay still in the air. Through the hanger workshop, players can also install an Operation Terminal, through which players can access San Andreas Mercenaries DLC missions.

3 FH-1 Hunter

Price: $3,100,000 - $4,123,000 (Trade price)

Based on

Boeing AH-64 Apache

Where to buy

Warstock Cache & Carry

Top speed

141.50 mph

Like Hydra, FH-1 Hunter is an OG attack chopper in the Grand Theft Auto franchise. It has appeared in each installment from GTA 3 to GTA Online , excluding GTA 4. This military helicopter is kitted out completely to wreck anyone. With the usual weaponry, it has a 7-missile barrage which can just annihilate any target, and a bomb bay through which players can drop explosive, gas, or incendiary bombs in clusters.

The co-pilot also gets control of the explosive autocannon. It can take 3 explosives before going down and, with the countermeasures, it can make a pretty good fight. Players can upgrade Hunter in their Hanger workshop and customize it to their liking.

2 Buckingham Akula

Price: $3,375,000 - $4,500,000 (Trade price)

Based on

Boeing–Sikorsky RAH-66 Comanche

Where to buy

Warstock Cache & Carry

Top speed

157.25 mph

When it comes to choppers, Akula is the best a player can get. Akula is among the few 4-seater offensive choppers and has all the generic weapon options, i.e., machine guns, homing, and non-homing missiles. Players can also equip a 4-missile barrage instead of homing missiles, but they sometimes feel useless. It also has a bomb bay available to it which can carpet a pretty hefty area.

For co-pilot, Akula has a 0.50 cal minigun turret that can be upgraded to a dual turret. Defensively, it can withstand 3 homing missiles or 3 RPGs. Akula also has a stealth mode and is highly maneuverable, so players can comfortably fly this helicopter in the city. All in all, Akula is a complete chopper that players must have in their Hangar.

1 Mammoth F-160 Raiju

Price: $5,141,250 - $6,855,000 (Trade Price)

Based on

Lockheed Martin F-35 Lightning II

Where to buy

Warstock Cache & Carry

Top speed

232.50 mph

The F-160 Raiju is a must-have aircraft in GTA Online. Ever since its release, it has been a popular choice for traveling from point A to Point B thanks to its great speed. It is faster than all the existing jets, including the P-996 Lazer and Hydra. In addition, Raiju has VTOL mode, which makes it much easier to land, but it can also accelerate quickly.

Players can customize its handling and change how it looks in the Hanger workshop to suit their playstyle. It has dual explosive cannons that can shred anything in its way and has homing and non-homing missiles. It also has a toggleable stealth mode to go off the radar, letting players travel without popping up on the map. It is decent for dogfighting but requires some practice. It also has great handling which enhances maneuverability. All this performance comes with a hefty price tag, but it's completely justified. So, players must save up and get Raiju if they want a great aircraft in GTA Online.

item.title: Elden Ring: The 16 Best Weapons For A Level 1 Run
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Hookclaws
  • Bloody Helice
  • Zweihander
  • Demi-Human Queen's Staff
  • Banished Knight's Halberd
  • Great Stars
  • Dragon Communion Seal
  • Club
  • Serpent-Hunter
  • Misericorde
  • Reduvia
  • Broadsword
  • Rellana's Twin Blades
  • Beast Claw
  • Scavenger's Curved Sword
  • Uchigatana

As far as challenge runs in Elden Ring go, staying at level 1 is one of the toughest. This essentially means starting out as a Wretch and never touching the level-up button. In some extreme cases, players will prefer to stay maidenless by ignoring Melina like a true chad; after all, she's the one who keeps pressuring players to raise their social status and their levels.

Since they're not accepting Melina's help in spending hard-earned Runes, then players will have to be self-sufficient with their weapons. Truth be told, weapon choice as a level 1 character in Elden Ring is quite limited. Some weapons requirements are too picky. Thankfully, a handful of weapons are low-maintenance and don't mind being in the hands of a naked, maidenless Wretch.

Updated January 9, 2025 by Erik Petrovich : When doing an Elden Ring Level 1 run, weapons selection is somewhat limited thanks to the lack of ways to increase base stats. Though there are few Legendary or particularly iconic weapons listed here, the best Elden Ring Level 1 run weapons are still significant in the game's lore, and have item descriptions that can shed light on special abilities or synergies of these best RL1 weapons. This guide to the best RL1 weapons Elden Ring players can use has been updated to provide these in-game item descriptions that shed light on the origins and special properties of these options.

16 Hookclaws

Weapon worn on the fist comprised of sharp parallel blades favored by those who lurk in the dark.

Stat Requirements

Str 8, Dex 14

Base Scaling

Str (E), Dex (C)

Scaling Max (+25)

Str (D), Dex (B)

Weapons Skill

Quickstep ( can be changed )

The Hookclaws are one of the best Level 1 weapons Elden Ring players can get because it can be found very early, and takes up almost no weight but offers its own unique two-handed moveset. When the two-handed input is pressed while equipped, you will automatically equip a second Hookclaw in your off-hand, and unlock its ridiculously fast dual-wield moveset.

This weapon does not have an innate status effect, but because the Ash of War can be changed, you can change it to a Bleed, Frostbite, or other weapon type to easily trigger these effects. These can be replaced with other Claw weapons later on if you meet their requirements, but the low stat requirements are nice for a RL1 run.

How To Get Hookclaws

To get the Hookclaws, head into Stormveil Castle via the side entrance revealed by Gatekeeper Gostoc , and look under the stairway for an Exile Knight. On the ground in this cellar-like room you should see the Hookclaws on a body in the corner.

15 Bloody Helice

Ominous piercing sword with a winding blade.

Carried by the noble servants of the Lord of Blood.

The extracted blood trickles gracefully down the length of the blade.

Stat Requirements

Str 16, Dex 19, Arc 17

Base Scaling

Str (E), Dex (D), Arc (D)

Scaling Max (+25)

Str (E), Dex (C), Arc (B)

Weapons Skill

Dynast's Finesse ( cannot be changed )

The Bloody Helice is one of the best RL1 weapons in Elden Ring because of its low stat requirements, low FP weapon skill, and ability to build up Bleed. You will still likely need to equip several items to be able to wield this weapon, but it's worth it for how strong it can be for a Level 1 run.

Use Marika and Radagon's Soreseals to raise your stats high enough to wield this weapon, which you should easily be able to acquire before reaching the location of this weapon.

How To Get Bloody Helice

To get the Bloody Helice, head to the Writheblood Ruins in the Altus Plateau and look for a way down to a boss chamber. Defeat the Sanguine Noble here to get the Bloody Helice.

14 Zweihander

Just about the largest sword a mere man is capable of swinging.

True to its name, it is designed to be wielded in both hands, but those of merely ordinary strength will still struggle to do so.

The long blade is heavy and sharp, sending foes reeling back with its broader strokes, while also capable of a devastating piercing thrust.

Stat Requirements

Str 19, Dex 11

Base Scaling

Str (D), Dex (D)

Scaling Max (+25)

Str (D), Dex (C)

Weapons Skill

Upward Stamp ( can be changed )

The Zweihander might not be the monster it once was when compared to its Dark Souls counterpart, but this Quality weapon at least finds its spot in Level 1 builds. It's one of the best alternatives to the hefty and demanding Greatsword. The Zweihander does come with its own high requirements for Strength, but that's easily fixed with a couple of talismans.

Rune Level 1 Players would want this since it's one of the best weapons to pair with the Lion's Claw Ash of War. This combo makes even a Level 1 run more than manageable. Players can use it to stunlock bosses from a relatively safe melee distance thanks to the Zweihander's range. Since it's also a colossal weapon, the Zweihander functions well as a shield.

How To Get Zweihander

To get the Zweihander in Elden Ring , head to the Weeping Peninsula, and continue to its furthest west beach. You should see a shack near where the sand begins – talk to the Isolated Merchant (Weeping Peninsula) inside to purchase a Zweihander for 3500 Runes.

13 Demi-Human Queen's Staff

Glintstone Staff styled as a scepter.

A gift once given to the demi-humans to foster peace, it can be wielded even by those of low Intelligence.

Sneered at by fools in the academy.

Stat Requirements

Str 6, Int 10

Base Scaling

Str (D), Int (C)

Scaling Max (+25)

Str (C), Int (S)

Weapons Skill

N / A

Most level 1 builds or runs in Elden Ring cater to melee players since they're easier to pilot. However, even magic builds can still have fun with the help of the Demi-Human Queen's Staff . It's one of the best staves in the game for those who have low Intelligence, such as level 1 builds. There are certain limitations to this staff.

For one, players can't infuse it with a weapon skill, so they're stuck with Sorceries. However, the Demi-Human Queen's Staff is thankfully impressive enough in buffing Glintstone Sorceries. Such a setup is definitely more challenging compared to a full melee build in a level 1 run, but it's still a good magic alternative.

How To Get Demi-Human Queen's Staff

To get the Demi-Human Queen's Staff, go to the Demi-Human Forest Ruins just to the west of the road heading to Castle Morne, and defeat the open-world boss Demi-Human Queen within.

12 Banished Knight's Halberd

A finely-crafted halberd intricately engraved with an ancient motif.

Given to knights who, whether by misfortune or misdeed, were forced to abandon their homes.

Most of these knights were sent to the fringes, where they were forced to start anew with only despair for company.

Stat Requirements

Str 14, Dex 12

Base Scaling

Str (D), Dex (D)

Scaling Max (+25)

Str (C), Dex (C)

Weapons Skill

Charge Forth ( can be changed )

Halberds are some of the most reliable weapons in Elden Ring due to their range and the powerful Ashes of War options for their weapon class. Most halberds in Elden Ring are heavy or have high requirements though, except for the Banished Knight's Halberd . Players can use this weapon with just a Radagon's Soreseal.

After that, they're free to pick from their halberd Ash of War of choice. There's quite a good number of powerful ones, but skills like Phantom Slash excel in dealing high damage with a fair amount of stagger or poise break. Players can even go around spamming that Ash of War until the late game.

How To Get Banished Knight's Halberd

The Banished Knight Halberd can be found in Stormveil Castle or as a drop from Edgar the Revenger . It can drop from slain Banished Knights, but an upgraded +8 version will drop from Edgar the Revenger. Edgar can be slaim in either Castle Morne, before finishing his quest, or in the Revenger's Shack in western Liurnia at the conclusion of his story.

11 Great Stars

Huge bludgeon with three stars at the striking end.

A blood-stained star is an ill omen, a fact not lost upon those against whom this weapon is brought to bear.

Stat Requirements

Str 22, Dex 12

Base Scaling

Str (D), Dex (D)

Scaling Max (+25)

Str (C), Dex (D)

Weapons Skill

Endure ( can be changed ). Also builds Bleed on hit.

For those who want a bit of everything that's busted when it comes to melee, Great Stars is a great start to a lot of fruitful kills. This huge morning star weapon in Elden Ring has innate Bleed damage buildup. Though don't expect it to rack up the Bleed meter in just a few strikes; it's a slow weapon.

However, it's also a heavy weapon, meaning it deals a good amount of stagger and works well even against larger enemies. With every hit you will restore a little bit of HP – not enough to make a huge impact, but enough to be noticeable.

Players can also customize the Ash of War or weapon skill to their liking. Strong Ash of War options include the Lion's Claw which fits well with the weapon.

The only problem is the Strength requirement but that's not too hard to fix with just a couple of talismans and a helmet.

How To Get Great Stars

The Great Stars location is on a Carriage, in the Altus Plateau just to the southwest of the Road of Iniquity Site of Lost Grace. Hit one of the giants pulling the Carriage, jump onto its back, and open the chest to get this weapon. It also drops from the "new" NPC Magnus the Beast Claw, found in a shack further north in the Altus Plateau.

10 Dragon Communion Seal

Formless drakeblood seal with a Dragon Communion crest.

The sacrificial devouring of the heart gives power.

Indeed, Dragon Communion is too primal in nature for the term "incantation" to be appropriate.

Stat Requirements

Faith 10, Arc 10

Base Scaling

Str (D), Arc (C)

Scaling Max (+25)

Str (B), Arc (S)

Weapons Skill

N / A

Even Faith builds that dip into Arcane can be viable in a level 1 run thanks to seals such as the Dragon Communion Seal . One incantation comes to mind when putting this seal together with a level 1 build and that's the Rot Breath spell. It's one of the most potent damage dealers in the game.

One breath and players can retreat to safety while their enemies die from the damage-over-time effect. The developers were even kind enough to set the Faith and Arcane requirement to just 10, which is the baseline state for the Wretch or the level 1 build template. Players only have to worry about adjusting their play style.

How To Get Dragon Communion Seal

The Dragon Communion Seal is located in the Fringefolk Hero's Grave , behind the Stonesword Key door near the beginning of Elden Ring . Look for a room with a Banished Knight inside, which will drop the Seal on defeat.

9 Club

A thick, solid lump of wood.

Wielding this striking weapon requires no skill.

A simple, primitive weapon that requires only brute strength and persistence to hammer your foe into the ground.

Stat Requirements

Str 10

Base Scaling

Str (C)

Scaling Max (+25)

Str (B)

Weapons Skill

Barbaric Roar ( can be changed )

Sure enough, one can't expect a great hammer if their arms are too frail. A simple Club is just about the best bludgeoning weapon available for a level 1 run. The Wretch's base stat barely meets the Club's base requirement of 10 Strength. That's good since there are no raising stats via leveling on a level 1 run.

Since it also deals bludgeoning damage, the Club is great for stunning or staggering enemies. It works particularly well against human-sized enemies, including bosses. The best part about the Club, however, is its flexible Ash of War slot.

How To Get Club

The basic Club is the starting weapon for the Wretch class, but it can also be dropped by any Demi-Human enemy in the game. If your luck is bad, and you didn't start as a Wretch, you can buy one from the Nomadic Merchant (Liurnia Lake Shore) near the Coastal Cave (beneath the cliffs at spawn) for 600 Runes.

8 Serpent-Hunter

Weapon that serves as both greatsword and spear.

Thought to have been used to hunt an immortal great serpent in the distant past, it manifests a long blade of light when facing such a creature.

When their master's heroic aspirations degenerated into mere greed, his men searched for a weapon with which they might halt their lord.

Stat Requirements

N / A (required for Rykard)

Base Scaling

Str (B), Dex (E)

Scaling Max (+25)

Str (A), Dex (E)

Weapons Skill

Great-Serpent Hunt

Players ought to thank Rykard. Because despite the gimmicky boss fight, his existence led to the creation of the. It's one of the few heavy weapons available for level 1 Wretches. It's thanks to the Serpent-Hunter's nonexistent stat requirement.

When fully upgraded, the Serpent-Hunter is quite decent. Scaling doesn't matter much here since players remain at base level 1 stats anyway. But the Serpent-Hunter's decent weapon skill is quite useful for stunning targets from a considerable distance. Besides, this weapon will wreck the entirety of Volcano Manor.

How To Get Serpent-Hunter

The Serpent-Hunter is found in Rykard, Lord of Blasphemy 's boss room, and is practically given to players for free. Upon entering his lair, look to the left on your way to the boss to find the Serpent-Hunter on the ground. Your character will even do a special animation to pull it out of the ground. This is practically required to defeat Rykard.

7 Misericorde

Dagger favored by military physicians in white.

Medicine is mercy. and mercy upon the battlefield is ruthless.

Beware the killers clothed as men of compassion.

Stat Requirements

Str 7, Dex 12

Base Scaling

Str (E), Dex (D)

Scaling Max (+25)

Str (E), Dex (C)

Weapons Skill

Quickstep ( can be changed )

Yes, the Miséricorde has a Dexterity requirement of 12, which automatically makes it too strong for a level 1 Wretch. However, there are ways to boost one's stat in Elden Ring . The Prosthesis-Wearer Heirloom, for example, will boost Dextery by five points. There are also Soreseals and Scarseals to help.

In any case, Misericorde is an awesome one-two-punch weapon. For maximum efficiency, players will have to slot in the Flames of the Redmane Ash of War in their Misericorde. That Ash of War can stun most enemies (even bosses) in just two casts. After that, players will have to go in for the critical hit while the targets are reeling. Misericorde's increased Critical Damage creates a good synergy here.

How To Get Misericorde

Misericorde is found in Stormveil Castle, behind a Stonesword Key room in the room with the giant Godfrey painting. There is a Banished Knight in the room, but you can pick it up off the ground without fighting it and run away.

6 Reduvia

Jagged dagger with a distinctive curled blade.

Carried by the noble servants of the Lord of Blood.

A proud testament to the success of its vicious design, this weapon is perpetually coated in blood.

Stat Requirements

Str 5, Dex 13, Arc 13

Base Scaling

Str (E), Dex (D), Arc (D)

Scaling Max (+25)

Str (E), Dex (C), Arc (B)

Weapons Skill

Reduvia Blood Blade

Picking Reduvia imposes the same challenge as Misericorde. Players will have to find ways through Talismans or gear pieces to raise their stats to meet the requirements. It's worth it for this dagger, though, as it's one of the most versatile weapons in the game.

Reduvia has a non-customizable weapon skill, but it's usually all that the players will need for ranged damage. Both the ranged attack and the regular attacks for Reduvia inflict Bleed build-up, which can result in a big chunk of damage once it's full.

How To Get Reduvia

To get Reduvia, head to the chasm that leads north from Lake Agheel (towards Murkwater Cave). An enemy called Bloody Finger Nerijus will invade, and begin to attack. A few seconds after he appears, Bloody Finger Hunter Yura will appear by your side and fight with you. Nerijus drops Reduvia on defeat whether Yura spawns or not.

5 Broadsword

A straight sword with a wide blade, suited to slashing attacks.

Horizontal swings boast wide attack range, making it easier to connect with foes.

Stat Requirements

Str 10, Dex 10

Base Scaling

Str (D), Dex (E)

Scaling Max (+25)

Str (C), Dex (D)

Weapons Skill

Square Off ( can be changed )

The Broadsword is the more elegant option in case players want to forego the caveman aesthetics of the Club. Its stat requirements fall in line with what the Wretch has at level 1 so that frees up some talisman slots for something else.

Sure enough, players might need something like the Shard of Alexander for this, since the Broadsword's strength lies in its default Ash of War, Square Off. This weapon skill is an underrated gem that can stagger targets. It also deals decent damage.

How To Get Broadsword

The Broadsword is the starting weapon for the Confessor class, but it can also be purchased from the Nomadic Merchant for 1800 Runes, who is right outside the Coastal Cave. Coastal Cave is found below the cliffs to the west of the spawn location.

4 Rellana's Twin Blades

Carian light greatsword embedded with blue glintstone.

Weapon of Rellana, the Twin Moon Knight. Two swords as a single armament.

Here, and here alone, were moon and fire ever together.

Stat Requirements

Strength 13, Dex 16, Int 16, Faith 16

Base Scaling

Strength (D), Dex (D), Int (D), Faith (D)

Max Scaling (+10)

Strength (C), Dex (C), Int (C), Faith (C)

Weapons Skill

Moon and Fire Stance

Rellana's Twin Blades is one of the best weapons for a Rune Level 1 run in Elden Ring , but that does come with two caveats: it requires beating Rellana Twin Moon Knight in the DLC, and to equip it at RL1 you will need to make some heavy adjustments to your Talismans and armor. Soreseals, direct stat boosts, and stat-boosting armor is required to meet the four relatively high stats.

But adjusting your build to meet the requirements is very worth it, as you are rewarded with one of the best boss weapons in the game. It scales equally with all stats, which works well with the default RL1 stat array, and its two weapon skills are especially powerful – the heavy attack, which spews a ring of fire around the Tarnished, is amazing for dealing with enemies at short range.

How To Get Rellana's Twin Blades

To get Rellana's Twin Blades, you must defeat Rellana, Twin Moon Knight at the end of Castle Ensis. On defeat she will drop the Remembrance of the Twin Moon Knight , which can be traded with Enia in Roundtable Hold for the Twin Blades.

3 Beast Claw

Weapon in the form of a carnivorous beast's vicious claws.

Used to perform bestial slashing attacks uncanny to humankind.

An imitation of the esoteric technique of the horned warriors.

Those who carry this weapon wield it as though they have been possessed by a savage beast.

Stat Requirements

Strength 13, Dex 11

Base Scaling

Strength (D), Dex (D)

Max Scaling (+25)

Strength (C), Dex (D)

Weapons Skill

Savage Claws

Arguably the best Rune Level 1 Elden Ring weapon found in the DLC, Shadow of the Erdtree , the Beast Claw (Weapon) is one of two new options in the eponymous Beast Claw weapon type. This weapon is remarkably fast, comes with a Poise-destroying Weapon Skill, procs Bleed by default, and can be infused to cause other status effects, too.

The Beast Claw has very low stat requirements and you won't need to do much to equip this great RL1 weapon, though it does require going into the DLC, which itself requires defeating two of the hardest bosses in the base game: Mohg, Lord of Blood , and General Radahn Set , who can normally be skipped in a base game run.

How To Get Beast Claw

The Beast Claw drops from the open-world NPC Logar the Beast Claw, who can be found in the forest east of the DLC spawn location in the Gravesite Plain in Shadow of the Erdtree .

2 Scavenger's Curved Sword

Unique curved sword, notched like shark's teeth.

Weapon carried by corpse pillagers who prowl the sites of old battles.

The blade is tacky with blood and covered in hefty nicks, making it totally uneven.

Life can be sinister indeed.

Stat Requirements

Str 9, Dex 14

Base Scaling

Str (D), Dex (D)

Scaling Max (+25)

Str (C), Dex (C)

Weapons Skill

Spinning Slash ( can be changed )

The Scavenger's Curved Sword is a key component for one of the most impressive Bleed builds for Elden Ring 's endgame. As a testament to the power of Bleed in Elden Ring , the Scavenger's Curved Sword can also prove to be a viable weapon for a level 1 run.

This weapon has one of the highest Bleed applications in the game. If infused with a Bleed prefix, then it becomes even more viable for the endgame despite having a level 1 wielder. Problems do arise against enemies who don't bleed, but thankfully, it's easy to change weapon prefixes.

How To Get Scavenger's Curved Sword

The Scavenger's Curved Sword can be found in Mt Gelmir, as you head north from the First Mt Gelmir Site of Lost Grace. Cross the bridge, and look on a corpse behind a Grafted Scion on this ledge to find the Scavenger's Curved Sword.

1 Uchigatana

A katana with a long single-edged curved blade.

A unique weapon wielded by the samurai from the Land of Reeds.

The blade, with its undulating design, boasts extraordinary sharpness, and its slash attacks cause blood loss.

Stat Requirements

Str 11, Dex 15

Base Scaling

Str (D), Dex (D)

Scaling Max (+25)

Str (D), Dex (C)

Weapons Skill

Unsheathe ( can be changed )

The Uchigatana , despite being a starter weapon for the Samurai class, scales well into the late game. It's one of the few rare weapons that players can use from beginning to end without much compromise. The Uchigatana owes much of its reputation to the Bleed build-up and its Unsheathe default Ash of War.

However, it can also be more versatile than that. Players can infuse it with cold damage so that it also triggers Frostbite on top of Bleed. In any case, it's one of the weapons that community legends such as Let Me Solo Her prefer to use against Malenia, Blade of Miquella .

How To Get Uchigatana

The Uchigatana is starting equipment for the Samurai class, but it can also be found in the Deathtouched Catacombs in northern Limgrave. Open the locked door, head back to the entrance to face the boss, and look for a corpse leaning over a ledge to pick up the Uchigatana.

item.title: Path of Exile 2: How Do Herald Of Ice And Thunder Work Together
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How to Use Double Herald (Herald of Ice + Herald of Thunder) in PoE 2
  • How Do Herald Of Ice And Thunder Work Together in PoE 2

In Path of Exile 2 , the Double Herald setup is a tech that allows for Herald of Thunder and Herald of Ice to proc off each other simultaneously, triggering a chain reaction that can clear entire screens with one hit.

Understanding how the Herald skills interact with each other in order to pull this off isn't strictly required, but it's helpful information nonetheless, especially for players wanting to theorycraft their own build ideas later on. Here's how to implement this tech in your build and an explanation on how it works afterward.

How to Use Double Herald (Herald of Ice + Herald of Thunder) in PoE 2

Four things are needed for the Double Herald setup to work:

  1. Herald of Ice Skill Gem socketed with the Lightning Infusion Support Gem
  2. Herald of Thunder Skill Gem socketed with the Cold Infusion Support Gem ( Glaciation is also recommended).
  3. 60 Spirit
  4. A way of inflicting Cold damage.

Remember to toggle on Herald of Ice and Thunder in the skills menu by right-clicking the skill icon in the skills menu.

Inherent skills like the Monk's Ice Strike are the most effective at proccing Herald of Ice, which is needed to start the chain reaction, but there are other ways to do it as well. Some of these are:

  • Passive skills that increase Freeze build-up with a weapon or glove that has flat cold damage.
  • Against the Darkness Time-Lost Diamond Jewel with +Cold damage percentage.

How Do Herald Of Ice And Thunder Work Together in PoE 2

Herald of Ice triggers when an enemy is Shattered, which is an effect that occurs when you attack an enemy that is frozen, creating an AoE cold damage explosion. To prevent this from triggering a chain reaction on its own, the cold damage from Herald of Ice can never Freeze an enemy and, therefore, cannot shatter them.

Herald of Thunder, on the other hand, triggers when you kill an enemy that has the Shocked status effect, creating bolts of electricity that damage enemies when you hit an enemy. Like Herald of Ice, Herald of Thunder cannot inflict Shock itself; it can only be triggered by Shock inflicted by other sources of damage.

Now, Herald of Ice cannot Freeze, but it can Shock , and Herald of Thunder cannot Shock, but it can Freeze . This means we can use one to trigger the other with reliable success. The way to do it is by putting the Lightning Infusion Support Gem on Herald of Ice and the Cold Infusion Support Gem on Herald of Thunder. These Support Gems convert a portion of the damage of Herald of Ice into Lightning, which can Shock, and a portion of the damage of Herald of Thunder into Cold, which can Freeze.

In optimal conditions, this means you can create chain reactions that continue indefinitely, with Herald of Ice proccing Herald of Thunder, which procs Herald of Ice again, and so on. In realistic scenarios, this mostly happens once, maybe twice, before the effect fizzles out. This is because to continue to perpetuate, you need a constant stream of monsters for the Heralds to leapfrog off of. This is also why Breaches are where the Double Herald setup shows the most value, due to the sheer number of enemies they can spawn.

To start this chain reaction, you will first need to proc Herald of Ice by Freezing, then shattering an enemy using a cold damage skill like the Monk's Ice Strike. This will create an icy explosion near you, which will also Shock to create a chain reaction. The reason we opt to proc Herald of Ice first is because Freeze is vastly easier to inflict than Shock and because the lightning bolts from Herald of Thunder can travel farther to target enemies that are far away better than Herald of Ice.

item.title: Elden Ring: The 16 Best Weapons For An Arcane Build
item.description:
It's no surprise that FromSoftware's latest game, Elden Ring , will set the bar for future FromSoftware entries. And that's because Elden Ring has shown the gaming community that it's possible to create a punishing Souls-like game while still leaving room for the newer audience to enjoy the game. Moreover, Elden Ring gives players near-limitless choices on how they want to approach Lands Between.

One playing style players enjoy using to beat the ill-omened creatures of Lands Between is with Arcane-powered weapons. And with the 1.03 update for Elden Ring , Arcane-type weapons received a notable buff. But, with so many to choose from, players would do well in learning which ones stand above the rest.

Updated January 9, 2025 by Erik Petrovich : In Elden Ring, Arcane weapons tend to be wreathed in mystery and intrigue, from something as simple as the arm of a Bloodfiend to the enigmatic and downright sinister Mohgwyn's Sacred Spear. Without looking directly on the item in your inventory, players might not ever know the significance of these best Arcane weapons Elden Ring has to offer. For example, did you know Rivers of Blood was originally part of an offering from Mohg to Okina to give him the life of a demon? Wielding Rivers of Blood after learning that makes your Elden Ring Bleed build feel much more awesome – this guide to the best Arcane weapons in Elden Ring has been updated to provide these item descriptions and shed light on the backstory of these iconic Arcane weapons.

16 Regalia Of Eochaid

Relatively Early Arcane Weapon With A Great Ash of War

Treasured sword of Eochaid, a lesser, long-vanished domain.

The copper coloration is not to be confused for rust, but is a conduit for its wielder to move it by their will alone.

Swords of Eochaid dance through the skies.

Regalia of Eochaid is perfect for players that haven't been able to obtain Marais Executioner's Sword since it shares similar attributes and has the same unique skill. But, the real reason why it fits perfectly with an arcane build in Elden Ring is that it primarily scales with Arcane despite having a D grade scaling when not upgraded.

For the best effect, players should only invest enough Dexterity and Strength points to be able to use it effectively and dump the rest into Arcane, as this means other Arcane weapons will be easier to use upon acquisition.

Its weapon skill is Eochaid's Dancing Blade, which lets players perform the same long-ranged, ethereal weapon attacks that the Bell Bearing Hunters, and Elemer of the Briar, use in battle. It's not particularly powerful, but can take a PvP opponent off-guard as they try to make some distance to heal.

Regalia Of Eochaid Location

Players can obtain this straight sword after going through the Gaol Cave in Caelid, though it can technically be reached from the Third Church of Marika with some precision. For the rest of us, it's on top of the cliff just outside the exit to the Gaol Cave in Limgrave. Make sure not to leave the boss room in the Gaol Cave, as the entrance to this outdoor area in Limgrave can only be accessed via a tunnel leading from this area.

15 Clinging Bone

Undoubtedly, Fist weapons are among the least used weapons in Elden Ring because most of them are lackluster and perform poorly in PVE and PVP. Fortunately, there's an exception with the Clinging Bone since it deals a decent amount of damage once a player has 30+ Arcane.

But, of course, nearly every other Arcane weapon has better damage output than this Fist-type weapon, but it is the best Fist weapon for any Arcane builds in Elden Ring.

The Ash of War that comes with Clinging Bone is Lifesteal Fist. A FromSoftware classic, Lifesteal Fist sees the wielder thrust their fist into an enemy and, if they connect with its very small hitbox, steal the life from them. It's very niche, and hardly ever lands, but it's hard to deny how cool it looks.

Clinging Bone Location

Players can obtain this weapon by defeating Ensha of the Royal Remains at the Roundtable Hold. To fight Ensha, you must have found at least one Great Rune – typically Godrick's Great Rune – and returned to Roundtable Hold. The lights will appear dim and no other NPCs will be present aside from Ensha, who tries to attack the Tarnished. Defeat Ensha to get their weapon, the Clinging Bone.

One beneficial part of using this Glintstone Staff is that it comes with no unique skill, which means that players have the freedom to choose among one of the few powerful staff-related Ashes of War in Elden Ring. There aren't many Ashes of War that can be applied to Staffs, but the ones that can – like the Spinning Weapon – are very useful when backed into a corner.

Albinauric Staff Location

Players can find this staff within the walls of Volcano Manor, but guarding it is a dreaded Omenkiller. Head upstairs from the Guest Hall grace and take a ladder up to the roof. Then, drop onto the ledge below to fight the Omenkiller. The Albinauric Staff can be found on the ground in the room you fight this formidable boss in.

Players can easily mow down most enemies with the Ripple Blade coated with grease, making it the perfect alternative to Mohgwyn's Sacred Spear (which involves fighting one of the most challenging bosses in Elden Ring ).

The Weapon Skill for the Ripple Blade is Wild Strikes, though it can be replaced with a huge variety of Ashes of War. Wild Strikes is great in the early game, but later on, consider changing this to Lion's Claw, Storm Stomp, or Sacred Blade.

The Ripple Crescent Halberd comes with the Spinning Slash Ash of War, a relatively cheap and effective Weapon Skill. It can be replaced, but for the early and mid game, it's not bad. Consider replacing it with Giant Hunt later on in Elden Ring .

Sadly, there are a very limited number of Arcane bows in Elden Ring , but the Serpent Bow makes up for that since it has a unique ability that causes arrows to deal Poison build up. Moreover, using Bloodbone Arrows with the Serpent Bow will make the weapon cause Blood Loss and Poison build up.

It's worth noting that the Arcane scaling doesn't influence the amount of Status Effect build up is not affected by Arcane scaling, just its damage. Of all the bows to add to an Arcane build Elden Ring offers its players, the Serpent Bow is the only one that relies on the stat at all, though.

In addition to its unique ability to inflict extra Poison damage, the Serpent Bow comes with the Mighty Shot Ash of War. This Weapon Skill lets its wielder spend a few more seconds to set up an incredibly powerful single shot – change this to Barrage to increase the Poison buildup of the bow, as Mighty Shot will inflict Poison once, while Barrage does it several times.

Serpent Bow Location

To make matters worse, within the cave are pools of Scarlet Rot, so players should only enter when they have the consumables or incantations to dispel it, like Flame, Cleanse Me.

Undoubtedly, the best Arcane weapon for PvE and PvP is the Rivers of Blood Katana. It's fast, it deals a lot of damage, it pairs extremely well with other Bleed katanas (when in the main hand), and its Ash of War is one of the most overpowered in the game – even after several nerfs.

Since it's a Katana, every attack can be performed in quick succession, leaving very little time for enemies or players to react. It's been nerfed a little bit, but it still reigns supreme amongst the other best Arcane Elden Ring weapons.

One of the reasons why most players favor Rivers of Blood weapon is because of its powerful Weapon Skill: Corpse Piler . This skill creates large streaks of blood that cause significant damage to enemies and players from far away while dealing huge Blood Loss build up. It takes up a lot of space but can be avoided, especially if the player decides to perform the follow-up attack on a target that's already dodged out of the way. Be sure to corner targets to virtually guarantee their death.

Rivers of Blood Location

Rivers of Blood drops from Bloody Finger Okina, who helped the Tarnished beat Radahn earlier in the game. Players that want to use this weapon will need to get it before reaching the Forge of the Giants and defeating the Fire Giant, at the Church of Repose on the way to the boss area.
